definitions.definition: One’s native land; the place or country in which one dwells; the place where one’s ancestors dwell or dwelt.
The locality where a thing is usually found, or was first found, or where it is naturally abundant; habitat; seat.
(of animals) To return to its owner.
(always with "in on") To seek or aim for something.
definitions.example: The missile was able to home in on the target.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to one’s dwelling or country; domestic; not foreign; as home manufactures; home comforts.
(except in phrases) That strikes home; direct, pointed.
Relating to the home team (the team at whose venue a game is played).
definitions.example: the home end, home advantage, home supporters

definitions.definition: At or in one's place of residence or one's customary or official location; at home
definitions.example: Everyone's gone to watch the game; there's nobody home.

definitions.definition: To a full and intimate degree; to the heart of the matter; fully, directly.
Into the right, proper or stowed position
A directory that contains a user's files.
